context.p: Most CAT (Computer Aided Translation) tools rely on TMX (Translation Memory eXchange) standard to exchange translation memory data. Unfortunately, some tools produce files that are not valid and others do not accept TMX documents that are correctly formatted.
TMXEditor checks the validity of TMX files against TMX DTD and also verifies if they follow the requirements described in TMX specifications.

step.cmd: In main menu, select File Validate TMX File... .
Use the dialog that appears to locate and select the file that you want to validate.
step.stepresult: A progress dialog is displayed while the file is analyzed.

taskbody.result: After checking the TMX file, a dialog with validation results appears.
